anime.description: This autumn will mark the opening of a major event organised by the Federation of International Vanguard Associations (FIVA), known as the G Quest. Those who conquer the 6 Branch Quests will be honored with the title Generation Master, and the chance to become a Clan Leader. The three members of TRY3 are all fired up by the new goal ahead of them, but behind the scenes, a massive plot that would lead to the destruction of Vanguard has been set in motion... What is this Plan-G that http://anidb.net/ch69679 [Ibuki Kouji] is devising to achieve his mission about? What future will http://anidb.net/ch70498 [Chrono] and the rest achieve through their new encounters!? Source: Cardfight Wikia

tag.name: shounen
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, shounen, literally meaning "youth" and often also specifically "boy", refers to a male audience roughly between the ages of 10 and 18. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: proxy battles
tag.description: In our terms, a proxy battle is a battle where humans use creatures/robots to do the fighting for them, either by commanding those creatures/robots or by simply evolving them/changing them into battle mode. Often the training aspect is also involved, or in some cases the proxies are nothing more than holographic representatives of some other variation of competition (like for example a card game). While many popular shounen anime fit under this category, it`s not limited to shounen anime.

tag.name: sports
tag.description: Sports anime revolves around a recreational physical activity or skill. In addition they often adhere to certain genre conventions, the emphasis on training and practice in preparation for competition, characters desire for self improvement, and pursuit of a specific goal.

tag.name: card games
tag.description: A card game is any game using playing cards as the primary device with which the game is played, be they traditional or game-specific. Countless card games exist, including families of related games (such as poker). A small number of card games played with traditional decks have formally standardized rules, but most are folk games whose rules vary by region, culture, and person. Many games that are not generally placed in the family of card games do in fact use cards for some aspect of their gameplay. Similarly, some games that are placed in the card game genre involve a board. The distinction is that the gameplay of a card game primarily depends on the use of the cards by players (the board is simply a guide for scorekeeping or for card placement), while board games (the principal non-card game genre to use cards) generally focus on the players` positions on the board, and use the cards for some secondary purpose.

episode.title: エースの罠
Ace`s Trap
Ace no Wana
episode.summary: A mysterious boy, Ace, manipulates Shion`s uncle and engineers a hostile takeover of the Kiba family business. The stakes are higher than ever as Shion fights Ace with the fate of the Kiba family on the line, not realizing that he stepped into a trap. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: クロノVSレオン
Chrono Versus Leon
Chrono VS Leon
episode.summary: As the three simultaneous fights between Team TRY3 and Special Aqua Force continue, powerful new cards debut and Chrono holds his own against Leon Soryu until the legendary leader announces that the wind will blow five times! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: スペシャルアクアフォース
Special Aqua Force
Special Aqua Force
episode.summary: Team TRY3 enters the first G Quest at Magallanica Branch, a team tournament that they easily dominate `til the end, when a specially-formed Aqua Force team shows up to sink them. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: Gクエスト開幕!
The G Quest Begins!
G Quest Kaimaku!
episode.summary: Chrono Shindou and the rest of Team TRY3 teach a beautiful girl, Yumizuki Luna, how to play Vanguard at Card Capital #2. Just then, a broadcast is made by the Vanguard Promotion Association announcing the start of their big event, the G Quest! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: めぐりあう場所
A Place of Chance Meetings
Meguriau Basho
episode.summary: Shion is searching for Ace, the boy who stole his family`s fortune. Chrono is focusing on getting stronger for a G Quest victory. But Tokoha feels left behind and without a goal. She lends a hand at Card Capital, which is mobbed with people waiting for the tournament to start, and has a talk (and a fight) with Misaki, who`s been in the same position before. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 覚醒のシオン
Shion`s Awakening
Kakusei no Shion
episode.summary: As the Dragon Empire Branch G Quest continues, both Tokoha and Chrono find themselves in "jail" and only Shion can get them out... by defeating the "guardian", Miwa! And he`d better do it fast because time is running out... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 嵐の夜
A Stormy Night
Arashi no Yoru
episode.summary: One stormy night, a haunted, dejected Shion runs into Kai. They have a series of fights in a nearby laundromat even as Shion fights his inner demons. Will the outcome be any help in the Dragon Empire Branch`s G Quest treasure hunt? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ラミーラビリンス
Rummy Labyrinth
Rummy Labyrinth
episode.summary: The TRY3 members help the Vanguard idol duo Rummy Labyrinth get ready for a performance. Novice idol and Vanguard fighter Luna wants to become friends with her strict, more experienced partner, Am, but seems to keep screwing up at every turn. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 櫂のイナズマ
Kai`s Lightning
Kai no Inazuma
episode.summary: Team TRY3 goes to the Stargate Branch for the latest G Quest, but find it sparsely attended because it`s just too difficult. The quest: to beat either Toshiki Kai or Kouji Ibuki. TRY3 gets its first of two chances as Shion fights his recent, onetime mentor, Kai! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 裸のファイト
Naked Fight
Hadaka no Fight
episode.summary: After Kamui takes Chrono and the boys to a neighborhood bathhouse for some "special training," a heated battle ensues between them. Also, Chrono learns that everything he`s ever heard about the planet Cray and its inhabitants is real! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 伝説のD
Legendary
Densetsu no D
episode.summary: Continuing from last week`s quest, TRY3 has to make it past various enemies and obstacles in a recreation of the Megacolony criminal empire before they get a chance to win back their championship medals from this week`s "guest boss!" Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: Zoo支部
Zoo Branch
Zoo Shibu
episode.summary: Team TRY3 competes against Naoki, Shingo, and many others as part of Zoo Branch`s Quest. Only one person can battle the mystery fighter from another country, but first all the teams compete in a Vanguard cooking contest. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 伊吹の誤算
Ibuki`s Miscalculation
Ibuki no Gosan
episode.summary: During the second half of their fight, Chrono and Ibuki get fed up with each other. Ibuki accuses Chrono of not improving since their last match, while Chrono is sick of Ibuki`s behind-the-scenes machinations. Can the two reach an accord and a satisfying ending to the fight? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ヴァンガード女子会
Vanguard Girls` Meet
Vanguard Joshikai
episode.summary: Luna wants to get closer to her Rummy Labyrinth idol partner, but Am seems distant and even depressed lately. When Luna goes to Tokoha and Kumi for advice, they end up running into Am and one silly argument later, Tokoha and Am are having a Vanguard showdown. Will this unofficial "girls` meet" end with breakup or a bond? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 新導ミクル
Mikuru Shindou
Shindou Mikuru
episode.summary: After the tournament, Shin talks with Chrono and reveals that he and Chrono`s father Rive were friends and teammates. Knowing that Chrono wants to face Ryuzu Myoujin and despite warning him that he may die, Shin decides to have a cardfight with Chrono to test his resolve. During the battle, Shin reveals Ryuzu was involved in Rive`s death, which causes Chrono to worry that Mikuru will be put in danger as well. But with some encouraging words from Mikuru, Chrono makes up his mind; he will protect both her and Vanguard from Ryuzu.

episode.title: カードキャピタル一号店
Card Capital #1
Card Capital Ichigouten
episode.summary: Shin holds a shop tournament at the original Card Capital, which brings together a mix of old favorites and newer characters. Does Chrono stand a chance against the fighter who taught Kamui everything he knows? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 普及協会の闇
Darkness of the Association
Fukyuu Kyoukai no Yami
episode.summary: While Kamui tries tracking down Ryuzu Myoujin at a seemingly abandoned Association facility, he runs into Mamoru, Trinity Dragon... and the operator of a dangerous high-tech security system. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: クロノVSレン
Chrono Versus Ren
Chrono vs Ren
episode.summary: The new version of a team fight, Relation Vanguard, continues with Chrono up against Ren and several powerful new cards. Meanwhile, Myoujin continues plotting behind the scenes to force creatures from Cray into captivity on Earth. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: トライスリーVSAL4
TRY3 Versus Asteroid
TRY3 vs AL4
episode.summary: TRY3 participates in the G Quest at the all-new United Sanctuary Branch, which is now run by Ren, Tetsu, and Asuka {Asaka}. In the end, the members of TRY3 are pitted against Team AL4 {Asteroid`s Team AL4} in a new twist on a "relay match." Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: シオンVSエース
Shion Versus Ace
Shion vs Ace
episode.summary: After getting stronger through the G Quest, Shion lures Ace out for a fight. Will he be able to regain the Kiba family fortune through a win? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: シオンVS櫂
Shion Versus Kai
Shion vs Kai
episode.summary: The second match of the ultimate stage is between Shion and Kai. The formerly wealthy upstart has lost to the old pro time and time again, but never has so much been hanging in the balance! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 決戦! チームQ4 トコハVSミサキ
Showdown! Team Q4 Tokoha Versus Misaki
Kessen! Team Q4 Tokoha vs Misaki
episode.summary: The first match of the ultimate stage pits Tokoha versus Misaki of the legendary Q4! If Tokoha loses, TRY3 won`t have the chance to help take down Ryuzu Myoujin, but does she even have a chance against Misaki`s incredible memory? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 決戦前夜
Night Before the Showdown
Kessen Zen`ya
episode.summary: The members of TRY3 try to relax and prepare for their fight against the mystery "dream team" the next day, while Ren and company work behind the scenes to track down Ryuzu Myoujin before he can summon the final unit from Cray. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ダークゾーン支部の罠
Dark Zone`s Trap
Dark Zone Shibu no Wana
episode.summary: Team TRY3 enter the final G Quest, sponsored by Dark Zone Branch, but it may be the hardest one yet as hundreds of opponents try to stop them from going undefeated in a haunted house-themed labyrinth! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: クロノVSカムイ
Chrono Versus Kamui
Chrono vs Kamui
episode.summary: It`s the third match climax of the TRY3-Q4 battle, Chrono versus Kamui! If Chrono wins, it means a complete for TRY3, but does he stand a chance against Kamui, who taught him everything he knows? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ギアースクライシス
Girs Crisis
Girs Crisis
episode.summary: In the series finale, it`s a fight to the finish for Chrono and Kamui as the Ren and the others enlist the help of fighters all over the world to pinpoint Ryuzu Myoujin`s hidden location. Source: crunchyroll
